content: I just noticed borders around impls and fns show up on docs.rs
I think I understand what problem they are trying to solve, but I don't think it ends up working well as a solution
Screenshot-2022-01-26-at-09.31.30.png
That is, assuming this is intentional?
Seems unintentional? It's not there on std's nightlies, like https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/vec/struct.Vec.html ...
Definitely not intentional. I agree that's not a good design.
what crate / version?
This was just futures
This was just futures
I'm not seeing this with https://docs.rs/futures/0.3.19/futures/index.html
Can you please send the exact link?
Also what's your browser version in case there is some oddity there? Do you see it on all docs.rs pages?
But I saw it on others too
It was on Firefox, latest release
What OS are you on?
current macOS
still seeing it on https://docs.rs/futures/latest/futures/prelude/stream/struct.FuturesUnordered.html
but I also don't see it on https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/vec/struct.Vec.html
But, I do see it on stable std docs: https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/option/enum.Option.html

I don't see the boxes on either of those. Do you have any Firefox extensions or configuration that might affect this? I suspect it's a local issue. You could also try bisecting (using --prompt and -- doc --open) with https://github.com/rust-lang/cargo-bisect-rustc/ to see what commit this changed at.

you should also be able to use the element inspector to see where the rule adding the borders is coming from. On Linux it's Ctrl-Shift-C, so probably Cmd-Shift-C on macOS. Hover around until the element with the borders appears to be highlighted, then click it- that will select the element in the Inspector tab of Dev Tools. Then look in the right-hand panel to see what border rules are active. If that panel isn't clear, you can click over to Computed, where it will show border-top-width, border-bottom-width, etc, with a little toggle to show the rule causing it and the file it came from.
Also, FWIW, I also use macOS with latest stable Firefox—so same platform—but I'm not seeing these lines. So I do suspect it's some kind of local config issue.
Hmm, it seems gone now
It was because of the search extension apparently. So I guess it was updated.
